About - Artemis for Android v Artemis is a digital directors viewfinder designed with both cinematographers and directors in mind. Artemis works nearly the same way as a traditional directors viewfinder, though much more accurately and much more conveniently. After selecting a camera format, aspect ratio and lens type, Artemis uses the camera in your mobile device to simulate the lens views you can expect when you come to shoot. You can either compare all the lenses or hit zoom and the camera will zoom in to fill the viewfinder with the equivalent view of the lens you have chosen. What cameras are covered?
Artemis has been field tested and tweaked with every camera in our database to make sure that the field of view is correct. With digital film cameras we found that relying on the information from camera manufacturers was not always wise.
The following formats are covered so far: \n\nStandard and Super 16mm\nSuper 16mm Anamorphic\nStandard and Super 35mm\n35mm Anamorphic\n65mm\n35mm Digital (D-21, RED, F35, Genesis)\n2/3 Digital (F23, Viper)\n1/2 Digital\n1/3 Digital\nCanon 5D and 7D.\n\n If you find a format that\'s important to you is missing let us know and we\'ll do our best to add it in the next update. Copyright 2010. Chemical Wedding. Artemis for Android was developed by Loon Films. Back

Camera device will NOT autofocus before taking each picture Camera device will autofocus before taking each picture Auto focus behaviour when long pressing the camera shutter (capture image) button. Long Press Shutter Button Focus Behaviour Camera device will use the torch while in preview mode Camera device will NOT use the torch while in preview mode Camera preview will show all colors Camera preview will be black and white. Note: this will also affect saved images. Device Camera Behaviour Device Camera Sensor Device Camera Angles The application will use the custom values shown below. The application will use the values automatically detected from the device (current values shown below). Detect Device Camera Angles Automatically Choose what to display in the heading of the main app. Enable/Disable the Lens boxes from changing position on touch. Lock Lens Boxes Choose the behaviour of the Android back button while the main app is running. Back Button Behaviour Haptic Feedback Artemis will NOT provide haptic feedback on button presses. Artemis will provide haptic feedback on button presses. The screen will be kept on and NEVER timeout while the main app is running. The screen will timeout according to your devices default sleep setting. Keep Screen On GPS Settings Screen Settings User Interface Behaviour GPS is disabled. The device will not search for it\'s location. GPS is enabled and the device will search for it\'s location. Key Mappings Don\'t override volume key behavior. Volume keys behave as default. "Override volume key behavior while the main app is running. " Override Volume Key Behavior Choose the behaviour when phones volume up key is pressed while the main app is running. Volume Up Key Behaviour Choose the behaviour when phones volume down key is pressed while the main app is running. Volume Down Key Behaviour NOTE: You must quit and restart the application for changes to take effect. Picture Save Location Select Image Size Select the size of the final image saved to disk. Saved Image Size Select Image Quality Select the quality (compression) of the image saved to disk. Saved Image Quality Images will NOT be smooth filtered. A filter will be applied to make the images appear smoother when scaling is required. An image preview will be shown after pictures are saved. Quick pictures are enabled. An image preview will NOT be shown after pictures are saved. Metadata
CUSTOM CAMERAS Add Custom Camera SQUEEZE RATIO (1.0) ASPECT RATIO (1.78) START ACTIVE SENSOR SIZE Squeeze Ratio is 1.0 for spherical lenses, 2.0 for standard 2:1 Anamorphic lenses and 1.3 for 1:3:1 Anamorphic lenses (ie Hawk V-lite 1.3\'s). After filing the above fields click start and hold your device at the nodal point. If using a 50mm lens, the lens nodal point is 50mm in front of the sensor plane. Using the plus and minus buttons, match the image you see on Atemis to the image on the camera. The inside red buttons are for finer adjustment and press SAVE when you are happy. Squeeze Ratio is 1.0 for spherical lenses, 2.0 for standard 2:1 Anamorphic lenses and 1.3 for 1:3:1 Anamorphic lenses (ie Hawk V-lite 1.3\'s). CHIP WIDTH (mm) CHIP HEIGHT (mm) Save Cancel Reset
